results.title: Green engineering: simple solutions to water pollution
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Environment Protection Authority and Stephen Cozens
results.brief_description: Using the Yarra River as an example, this video shows how sediment pollution of rivers can be reduced by using green engineering and how silt traps at building sites can be useful on eroded sites.

results.creator_credit: CBS, Isadore Freleng and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: Animated version of the Dr Seuss story from ‘Dr Seuss on the Loose’. Full of imagery, action and language, the story moves to a predictable and satisfying conclusion.

results.title: Green ceilings of Borneo
results.brief_description: In the dense tree-tops of the Borneo jungle, animals have adapted to the problem of getting from one tree-top to another without climbing down. This shows gliding lizards, squirrels, snakes, orang-utan and a large fruit bat.

results.title: Green Card
results.creator_credit: Greencard Productions, Peter Weir and Jean Gontier
results.brief_description: Directed by internationally acclaimed Peter Weir, this charming comedy is based on a very real issue facing many foreigners in the United States today - the possibility of marrying an American citizen in order to obtain a “greencard” which allows them to live and work in America. Starring the big, lovable Depardieu, in his english-speaking film debut, as a French alien who wants to remain in the US, and MacDowell as a New York horticulturalist who desperately wants to rent an apartment with a greenhouse (the owners of which only want to rent to married couples). Through a mutual friend they meet and strike a deal - they’ll get married so that each can have what they desire. They marry in a quick legal ceremony and then part company, only to find they must get to know one another and act as husband and wife when immigration officials begins snooping around.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greencard Productions, Peter Weir and Jean Gontier

results.title: Green buds of hope
results.brief_description: Child welfare facilities in post war Poland; effect of such services on child mortality figures; new baby clinics established in city areas; mobile clinic units, creches, and activities in the country’s 7000 nursery schools, where children receive free medical and dental attention; during vacations, holidays are organized and children from Warsaw and Krakow visit the mountains or the seaside.

results.title: Green animation
results.creator_credit: World Wildlife Fund, Sally Richardson and Claire Breese
results.brief_description: Tony Robinson, (Baldrick in Blackadder), and Aardman animator Peter Lord introduce a compilation of short animated films by student and professional animators which emphasise the need to care for our fragile planet and its resources. The aim is to make us think, rather than to preach, and as such would be a valuable resource in environmental education. Divided into three parts, the first sets the scene as we voyage through time and space. Part two emphasises the finiteness of resources and is full of anger, irony, fear and rampaging trees. Part three moves away from an implied pessimism to show us the light at the end of the tunnel with crazy notions of simplicity, moderation and reforestation as part of a global solution. The commentary by the two hosts provides an insight into the animation processes and the range of techniques and styles. The messages are often simple and swift, but they leave a lasting impression.

results.title: Green and gold greats
results.brief_description: This program brings together a fifty year span of Australian sporting splendour including performances of Don Bradman, Dawn Fraser, Heather McKay, Walter Lindrum, Majorie Jackson, Betty Cuthbert, Herb Helliot, Peter Thomson, Les Darcy, Vic Patrick, Merwyn Wood, Lew Hoad, Ken Rosewall and Phar Lap.

results.title: Green
results.brief_description: Surfing set to music - documentary footage of professional male surfers from four locations across the world and featuring some 50 surfers. Heaps of slow-motion short-board action and a few wipeouts just to keep things interesting. Shot in Mexico, Australia, California, and Hawaii by producer/director Matt Wybenga. Some of the surfers featured include: Joel Parkinson, Mick Fanning, Andy Irons, Kelly Slater and Taj Burrow. Music includes artists DJ Shadow, Ziggy Marley, Single Handed and Coal Chamber.
